sen.j: 藤原 在衡（ふじわら の ありひら、寛平4年（892年） - 天禄元年10月10日 (旧暦)（970年11月11日））は平安時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Born in 892 and gone on November 11, 970, "FUJIWARA no Arihira" was "Kugyo"(a top Court official) in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.e: Arihira was the son of "FUJIWARA no Ariyori," who was "Tajima no kuni no suke" (the assistant governor of Tajima Province) and the child of "FUJIWARA no Yamakage" ("Chunagon," or Middle Counselor), but a theory says Arihira was in real the child of "Nyomu," who was "Daisozu" (the Buddhist priest in the second highest position) and the younger brother of Ariyori.

sen.j: 若年時に鞍馬寺において天童の予言を受けたという話や、天皇の下問には周到な準備をもって的確に答え、しかも風雨を厭わず参勤した話などが、『古事談』に収められている。
sen.e: "Kojidan" (Talks of the Past) says, for example, that he got a prophecy from "Tendo" (the embodiment as a child of a ferocious god who protects the Buddhist Law) at Kurama-dera Temple in his youth, and that he answered appropriately on a thorough preparation when the emperor asked him a question, and that he visited and served the emperor even on a windy or rainy day.
